column4: guys anyone care to tell me how i check for restricted drivers?
which video card?    lspci | grep -i vga    in a terminal will tell you exactly
00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation Mobile 945GM/GMS, 943/940GML Express Integrated Graphics Controller (rev 03)
that chip doesn't have a restricted driver, the one that comes native with ubuntu is the best available
so why i cant enable the visual effects?
because it has a bug, and is blacklisted. See http://wiki.compiz-fusion.org/Hardware/Blacklist for the reason, and a way to override the blacklisting
how i can use this command in terminal? "SKIP_CHECKS=yes compiz-manager"
type it directly in the terminal, without the   "  .
i done what the page says but it doesnt seem i can enable my grafics now:/
if that command worked, you'd have the effects running immediately. I've seen some 965's work, and others not. Don't know why.
so i cant use any effects now ?
maybe when hardy comes out, you should ask for info about it in #ubuntu+1 (only a couple weeks away)
I meant ask for info in #ubuntu+1 now, that is. That sentence didn't quite say that :)
when i do that command i get some error too
you can get more info on #compiz-fusion as well
